alert.note: Alert for Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southern Franklin (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 27 at 3:23AM EST until February 27 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 10 AM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches for a storm total of 3 to 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. * WHERE...Southeastern Saint Lawrence and Southern Franklin Counties in New York. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 7 PM EST this evening. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 1 AM to 10 AM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions today. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills on Monday morning could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light to moderate snow is expected this morning ahead of an approaching cold front. As the front passes from north to south this afternoon and evening, snow squalls are possible which may produce quick accumulations of snow, strong winds, and drastic reductions in visibility.
info.instruction: Slow down, use caution while traveling, and have a way to receive weather alerts. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
